desc: Change in Registrar & Share Transfer Agent
attchmntText: Bharat Electronics Limited has informed the Exchange that "Pursuant to the scheme of merger approved by the High Court of Karnataka and High Court of Tamil Nadu, M/s. Alpha Systems Pvt, Ltd. ("Erstwhile Registrar"), having its Registered Office at No. 30, Ramana Residency 4th Cross, Sampige Road, Malleswaram,Bangalore-560003, has merged with M/s. Integrated Enterprises (India) Limited ("Current Registrar"), having its registered office at 5A, "Kences Towers", No.1,Ramakrishna Street, North Usman Road, T. Nagar, Chennai -600 017 ("Merger"). Consequent to the Merger, all the registrar and share transfer agent assignments of our Erstwhile Registrar stands transferred to M/s. Integrated Enterprises (India) Limited, a Category I Registrar and Transfer Agent and the Bangalore Office of our Erstwhile Registrar has become a branch office of the Current Registrar." Following are the details of Current Registrars : (a) Name of the R&T Agent: INTEGRATED ENTERPRISES (INDIA) LIMITED. (b) Address of R&T Agent's office at Bangalore handling our assignments : 30, Ramana Residency, 4th Cross,.Sampige Road, Malleswaram, Bangalore - 560 003.

News Verification : The media had reports that Bharat Electronics Ltd may announce a bonus issue of shares. The Exchange, in order to verify the accuracy or otherwise of the information reported in the media and to inform the market place so that the interest of the investors is safeguarded, had written to the officials of the company. Bharat Electronics Ltd has vide its letter inter-alia stated,"It is clarified that the company has not made any announcement/statement regarding bonus issue. The company does not have any plan for bonus issue at present. The published news is, therefore, speculative in nature."

The Exchange, in order to verify the accuracy or otherwise of the information reported in the media and to inform the market place so that the interest of the investors is safeguarded, had written to the officials of the company. Bharat Electronics Ltd has vide its letter inter-alia stated, "It is clarified that the Company is entering into a Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) with the American Company, M/s Northrop Grumman Overseas Service Corporation for the purpose of identifying market opportunities commensurate with their respective technology and to identify the possibility of mutually beneficial collaborative efforts. This will be followed by a Teaming Agreement in the course of time. This MOU is a part of the Company's continuous efforts to explore new business opportunities through collaborative efforts and is futuristic in nature."

Bharat Electronics Ltd has informed the Exchange that ICRA Ltd. conducted the Surveillance of Rating for Rs. 100 crores short term debt programme (including commercial paper and inter-corporate deposits) of the Company and has assigned a rating of "A1+" (A one plus) indicating highest credit quality rating assigned by it to short-term debt instruments. The validity period of the rating assigned is from February 10, 2006 to February 09, 2007.

The details of the press release shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/Corporate Announcements).

Clarification of News : The media had reports on January 23, 2006 that Bharat Electronics Ltd is likely to bag a Rs.1000 crore defence order. The Exchange, in order to verify the accuracy or otherwise of the information reported in the media and to inform the market place so that the interest of the investors is safeguarded, had written to the officials of the company. Bharat Electronics Ltd. has vide its letter inter-alia stated, "It is clarified that the Company has not made any announcement/statement regarding the receipt or bagging of any such defence order. The Company keeps receiving orders from customers from time to time. However, the Company is not aware of any particular order of Rs. 1000 crore as reported by the media. The published news is, therefore, speculative in nature."

Clarification of News : The media had reports that Bharat Electronics Ltd is likely to bag a Rs.1000 crore defence order. Bharat Electronics Ltd has informed the Exchange that the one day token strike by the employees of 4 of the 9 units of the Company has ended on the evening of September 29, 2005 and normal operations have resumed on September 30, 2005 in all 4 units of the Company that were on strike.
Bharat Electronics Ltd has informed the Exchange that the employee trade unions of 4 of the 9 Units of the Company have called for a one-day token strike on September 29, 2005.

Bharat Electronics Ltd has informed the Exchange that the shareholders of the Company at their AGM held on September 16, 2005 declared payment of 72% Final Dividend on the paid up equity capital of the Company (Dividend @Rs.7.20/- per share). The Company has further informed that they have fixed October 11, 2005 as the due date of Final Dividend for the year 2004-05.
Bharat Electronics Ltd has informed the Exchange that Vice Admiral P. Jaitly, PVSM, AVSM, VSM has ceased to be on the BODs of Bharat Electronics Limited.
Bharat Electronics Ltd has informed the Exchange that Air Marshal K.S. Chaturvedi, VSM, has ceased to be on the BODs of the Company.

Bharat Electronics Ltd has informed the Exchange that the Register of Members and the Share Transfer Register of the Company would be closed from September 02, 2005 to September 16, 2005, both days inclusive, for the purpose of taking record of the Shareholders for the payment of Dividend for the year ended March 31, 2005 and in connection with the AGM of the Company proposed to be held on September 16, 2005. The final dividend for the year 2004-05, when declared at the AGM, will be payable within 30 days from the date of declaration of dividend by the members.

Bharat Electronics Ltd has informed the Exchange that the Board of Directors of the Company met on June 21, 2005 and recommended a final dividend of 72% (i.e. Rs.7.20 per equity share of Rs.10/- each) in addition to the Interim Dividend of 40% paid in December, 2004.

Bharat Electronics Ltd had informed the Exchange that the employee trade unions of 7 of the 9 units of the Company had called for a one-day token strike on June 09, 2005. The Company has now informed that the strike has ended on the evening of June 09, 2005 and normal operations have resumed on June 10, 2005 in all 7 units of the Company that were on strike.
Bharat Electronics Ltd has informed the Exchange that the employee trade unions of 7 of the 9 units of the Company have called for a one-day token strike on June 09, 2005.
